title.value: The use of artificial intelligence and virtual reality in doctor-patient risk communication: A scoping review
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly stated at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: The use of artificial intelligence and virtual reality in doctor-patient risk communication: A scoping review

extractions.description: This paper is a scoping review that explores the application of artificial intelligence (AI) and virtual reality (VR) technologies in enhancing doctor-patient communication, particularly in the context of surgical risk communication and shared decision-making (SDM).

type.justification: The paper is a scoping review, which typically involves a theoretical analysis of existing literature rather than empirical experiments.
type.quote: this review aims to explore the current use of AI and VR in doctor-patient surgical risk communication.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the application of AI and VR technologies in medical contexts, specifically in doctor-patient communication.
name.quote: Objectives: While the development of artificial intelligence (AI) and virtual reality (VR) technologies in medicine has been significant, their application to doctor-patient communication is limited.

name.justification: The focus is on improving communication between doctors and patients using AI and VR.
name.quote: this review aims to explore the current use of AI and VR in doctor-patient surgical risk communication.

name.justification: The paper addresses shared decision-making in surgical contexts as a key aspect of risk communication.
name.quote: As communicating risk is a challenging, yet essential, component of shared decision-making (SDM) in surgery.
